summary: Completed comprehensive frontend testing of Lawvek B2B SaaS website dark theme implementation. All sections consistently display dark theme. All features working correctly including CTA buttons, Early Access Modal, form submission, and queue counter.
passed_tests: Hero section: Dark background with overlay (#0A0F1A/85), centered text, white CTA pill button
Hero section: 'Lawyer Assisted AI' amber badge visible
Hero section: Spots left counter displays properly (13 spots left)
Problem section: Dark background (#0F172A) with dark cards and border styling
Approach section: Dark background (#0A0F1A) with dark cards and amber accents
How It Works section: Dark background with Slack demo animation working
How It Works section: Pipeline visualization with animated steps
Benefits section: Dark background (#0F172A) with emerald hover effects on icons
Integrations section: Dark background with dark themed icon boxes
Integrations section: Central hub (L logo) visible with animated connecting lines
Comparison section: Dark background with Lawvek vs Traditional Law Firm comparison
Security section: Dark background with 4 feature cards (SOC 2, AES-256, Zero Data Training, US Data Centers)
CTA section: Dark gradient background with 'Get Priority Access' button
Footer: Dark theme (#0F172A) with proper navigation links and social icons
Header: Transparent on hero (white text/button), transitions to white when scrolling
Header CTA button opens Early Access Modal correctly
Hero CTA button opens Early Access Modal correctly
CTA Section button opens Early Access Modal correctly
Early Access Modal: Properly centered, dark theme (#0B1120)
Early Access Modal: Spots left counter displays in amber badge
Early Access Modal: Form fields (name, email, company size) fillable
Early Access Modal: Company size dropdown working correctly
Early Access Modal: Subscribe checkbox clickable
Early Access Modal: Form submission shows success message 'You're #X in queue'
Queue counter increments correctly on form submission (stored in localStorage)
Mobile responsiveness: Hamburger menu toggle visible
Mobile responsiveness: Dark gradient mobile menu with navigation links
Mobile responsiveness: 'Get Priority Access' button in mobile menu
Mobile responsiveness: Hero section displays correctly on mobile
critical_code_review_comments: Minor: TrustStrip and WhyItWorksSection components are exported but not used in App.js - intentional design decision
Minor: Landing page wrapper has bg-[#F9F9F9] but all sections override with dark backgrounds - no visual impact
context_for_next_testing_agent: All dark theme features have been verified. The website consistently displays dark, premium, enterprise-grade design across all sections. Early Access Modal works correctly with form validation and queue counter stored in localStorage. Mobile responsiveness is excellent with a dark gradient mobile menu. Note: TrustStrip and WhyItWorksSection components exist but are not rendered in current App.js composition.
